Fossegrimen

NPC ID808

Fossegrimen is a Fremennik spirit who enchants player's lyres so that playing the lyre teleports the player to Rellekka. Only players who have started or completed The Fremennik Trials quest may use the lyre teleport.

Contents

  • 1 Charging lyre
    • 1.1 Permanent charges
  • 2 Changes
  • 3 Trivia

Charging lyre[edit | edit source]

Fossegrimen requires an offering to enchant a lyre. This offering must either be a raw shark, raw manta ray, or raw sea turtle. Using an activated ring of charos, a raw bass may be substituted for a raw shark. When making temporary charges, she will not accept noted fish.

Offering Number of Teleports With Easy Diary Bonus Cost per Charge Cost with Easy Diary Bonus
Raw shark 2 3 380 253.33
Raw bass - (Ring of charos (a)) 2 3 9 6
Raw manta ray 3 4 449.33 337
Raw sea turtle 4 5 206 164.8

Permanent charges[edit | edit source]

After completion of The Fremennik Trials, players can imbue their lyre into an enchanted lyre(i), which contains infinite charges, by offering Fossegrimen a one-off offering of 1,000 raw sharks, bass, manta rays and sea turtles, costing 2,950,000. Fossegrimen will accept both noted and un-noted offerings, and they can be given in increments; she will inform players of the remaining amount required to imbue the lyre. When you charge the lyre to infinite, you must right click the altar choosing summon. Fossegrimen will explain the process and cost, until you are prompted to offer your noted fish, don't offer anything to the altar.

The offering cost will drop by 200 raw fish (590,000) for each tier of the Fremennik Diary completed. However, she will not return any fish once a higher tier of the diary has been completed.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
5 March 2015
(update | poll)

Fossegrimen will now give your enchanted lyre an extra charge when making a sacrifice if you have completed the Fremennik Easy Diary.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Fossegrimen is based on the Norwegian mythical creature Fossegrim.
